item.title: Report X-2025030314
item.description:
Report X-2025030314

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-16T21:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-07
  • City: CARLISLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Camp Iluches, 042 Operations Supervisor, contacted Safety regarding a UN3266 corrosive liquid spill on the trailer floor. Camp Iluches advised the pallet of freight was not properly blocked and braced. Camp Iluches also stated that the pallet had other freight stacked on top with no dunnage resultin g in the spill. Camp Iluches advised CURA to be contacted on straight time. Camp Iluches stated the trailer is secured and blocked off and there is not active leak.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER REPORTED TO IRREG BELT 6. WEARING PROPER PPE USED THE DECISION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEETS FOR FLAMMABLE LIQUID.THE BOX WAS ON THE BELT. BOX WAS WET ON THE SIDE AND BOTTOM. NO LIQUID ON THE BELT NO NEED FOR ZEP ZORBENT. RESPONDER PLACED THE BOX IN A GREEN PLASTIC DMP BAG AND REMOVED IT TO THE DMP CAGE FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

item.title: Report X-2025030160
item.description:
Report X-2025030160

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-16T21:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-03
  • City: CARLISLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Operations supervisor advised that a small pail of hazardous material appears to have been previously recouped but was discovered to be leaking on the OS and D trailer. The operations supervisor advised that no more than 8 fl oz had spilled from what appears to be a 5 gallon pail. The spill is conta ined to the trailer. CURA was contacted for remediation. It was determined that the pail was punctured by other freight due to freight shift while in transit.

item.title: Report X-2025030532
item.description:
Report X-2025030532

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-16T21:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-27
  • City: EASTON
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: HAZMAT AUDITOR SENT TO PACKAGE CENTER TO PICK UP UNAUDITED HAZMATS AND CAME BACK WITH THIS PACKAGE AS WELL. PACKAGE DRIVER REPORTED THAT THE SHIPPER HAD TOLD THEM THE DAY PRIOR THAT THEY WOULD HAVE A HAZMAT SHIPMENT, BUT THE DRIVER DID NOT REALIZE UNTIL THEY WERE BACK THAT THEY DID NOT SEE ANY HAZMAT SHIPMENTS. THE CLERK OPENED THE PACKAGE IN QUESTION TO CONFIRM THAT IT WAS OR WAS NOT HAZARDOUS AND WHEN SHE SAW THE GROUND LIMITED QUANTITY, SHE MADE SURE IT WAS HANDED OVER TO THE DMP. REWRAP; NO LEAK

item.title: Report E-2025030136
item.description:
Report E-2025030136

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-16T21:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-27
  • City: ETNA
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: A. DUIE PYLE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: While loading pallet into trailer material handler noticed a slight leak coming from one of the pails. Further investigation revealed that a nail protruding from the pallet the pail was staged on had slightly punctured the bottom of the pail. Spilled material was cleaned with absorbent and placed into a recovery container as was the punctured pail.

item.title: Report E-2025030135
item.description:
Report E-2025030135

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-16T21:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-26
  • City: ETNA
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: A. DUIE PYLE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: While loading drum into trailer material handler discovered that there was a slight leak originating from the top bung closure. Further investigation revealed that one of the top bung closures was loose. Bung was tightened and drum was delivered to ultimate consignee without further incident. Spilled material was cleaned with absorbent and placed into a recover container.

item.title: Report E-2025020411
item.description:
Report E-2025020411

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-16T21:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-19
  • City: MCKEES ROCKS
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Clean Harbors was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 2 feet by 2 feet area of concrete terminal floor and estimated that one (1) gallon of material was released due to a forklift accident puncturing one (1) 275-gallon plastic tote. Clean Harbors personnel stated that absorbents had been applied, and a neutralizer was used to the affected concrete area. The personnel then began a tote transfer from the punctured tote to a new tote. The old tote was cut up and placed in two (2) 55-gallon poly drums along with the impacted absorbents. The two (2) 55-gallon poly drums were staged onsite at the terminal prior to the contractor demobilization. Personnel were told the 330-gallon tote of product would be shipped on to the customer. The generated waste will remain onsite for the Dayton Freight Lines team to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025030120
item.description:
Report E-2025030120

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-16T21:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-16
  • City: GREENCASTLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: A. DUIE PYLE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: While loading freight into a trailer forklift operator did not realize the forkblades from the forklift were protruding from the shipment they we carrying and when they went to stage the shipment into a trailer the protruding forkblades struck a carton already staged in the trailer, puncturing an inner container consequently contributing to the unintentional release. Spilled material was cleaned with absorbent and placed into a recovery container as was the damaged carton and can.

item.title: Report E-2025030118
item.description:
Report E-2025030118

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-16T21:12:33+00:00

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: While unloading freight from trailer material handler discovered a drum that had fallen off a pallet during transit. As a result, when the drum fell over it hit the corner of the pallet it was staged on slightly puncturing the drum contributing to the unintentional release. Spilled material was cleaned with absorbent and placed into a recovery container as was the punctured drum.

item.title: Report I-2025020052
item.description:
Report I-2025020052

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-16T21:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-11
  • City: SHARPSBURG
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: PENN TANK LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 165400
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: Truck driver lost control of vehicle, struck cement barrier on side of roadway. Driver over corrected causing the trailer to sway, then rollover. Unit remained on roadway and no other vehicles were involved. This trailer consisted of 4 compartments. The last compartment received a puncture spilling 2,000 gals. of ULSD B2. The product ran down the roadway and entered storm drains that discharged rain fall into Pine Creek. Pine Creek discharges into The Allegheny River approximately 1 /2 mile downstream from the spill. The duration of the release was immediate & flowed freely until fire department was on scene. The trailer was an aluminum MC 306 built by Custom in the year 1995. Multiple fire departments were on scene along with the PA State Police, Allegheny County Hazmat, Etna Baro Police and others. On initial impact a fire started from product spilled along the barrier wall when contacted and ruptured. The fire department extinguished with no incident. The driver exited from the cab on his own, transported to ER and released with no injuries other than a cut on his hand. The fire departments blocked the drains with booms and other material to stop any continuous flow that could occur. A HM Spill Contractor was called to remove the remaining ULSD from the other 3 compartments. The trailer needed to be drilled to install a pump out hose into the tank. Product was transferred without further incident. The contractor was completing cleanup while the action of pumping the trailer was done. After the truck was righted and removed from the scene under tow, the contractor continued with the cleanup under the supervision of the PennDOT responder. Fire crews installed booms in the creek and at the mouth where the creek empties into the Allegheny River. The creek and river are an ongoing project to retain and remove product. Multiple state and local agencies are involved in monitoring the spill cleanup actions.

item.title: Report E-2025030151
item.description:
Report E-2025030151

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-16T21:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-10
  • City: ALLENTOWN
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 50000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: t 0415 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at XAN. It was reported that approximately 100 gallons of Enviroset 40E FNB Resin were released from a 275-gallon plastic tote due to improper loading by XAN. The release impacted trailer #4413259 and the concrete outside the trailer. ERTS will proceed to dispatch a contractor to the site to complete cleanup activities. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 200-gallons of UN2874 Enviroset 40E FNB Resin product released to the entire wooden trailer floor and the concrete beneath the trailer which spread to nine trailer bays, as well as sewer drain was impacted. The contractor applied speedy dry to the release that impacted the concrete and placed booms around the drains as well as the outfall. The estimated 10-gallons still in the tote was solidified with speedy dry and the tote were placed in a roll off for disposal. The contractors flushed the impacted sewer drain and vacuumed and filled (3) totes with impacted water/product. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.
